name: Dhur
explanation: 4 Raka'ah prayed at its time

name: Asr
explanation: 4 Raka'ah prayed at its time

name: Maghrib
explanation: 3 Raka'ah prayed at its time

name: Ishai
explanation: 4 Raka'ah prayed at its time

name: Fajr
explanation: 2 Raka'ah prayed at its time

name: Jamaah (Solah)
explanation: Observing Solat in congregation and in the mosque

name: Alone (Solah)
explanation: When any of the Solat is observed alone and at home

name: Adhkar After (Solah)
explanation: It is the supplication enjoyed by the prophet to be done after every compulsory solat

name: Rawatib
explanation:
The 12 Nawafil (super-rogatory prayer) before and after each compulsory solat which include;
i. 2 or 4 raka'ah before Zuhr and 2 raka'ah after zuhr
ii. 2 Rak'ah before Asr
iii. 2 Rak'ah before magrib and 2 rak'ah after magrib
iv. 2 Rak'ah before Ishai and 2 rak'ah after Ishai
v. 2 Rak'ah before Subhi and 2 rak'ah after Subhi

name: Nawafil
definition: The different types of nawafil (Tahajjud, Duha, etc)
explanation: The different types of nawafil (Tahajjud, Duha, etc)

name: Tahajjud
explanation: At least 2 rak'ah especially at the third part of the night

name: Dhua
explanation: At least 2 raka'ah at sunrise (reward of one that performs umrah)

name: Taobah
explanation: 2 rak'ah before sleeping (reading suuratul kaafirun and ikhlas in the 2 rak'ah)

name: Shafi And Witr
explanation: 2 rak'ah of rawaatib after ishai, and 1 witr after it and can be delayed till after Tahajjud

name: Adhkar
explanation: Done in the morning and evening or night (after subh or anytime in the morning and before magrib or before sleeping)

name: Morning (Adhkar)
explanation: Subhi adhkar after Solat

name: Evening (Adhkar)
explanation: Asr adhkar after solat

name: Quran
explanation: Must be done everyday at least a Juz'u from suuratul Baqarah

name: Hifdh
explanation: Memorising at least a new verse everyday(pick a chapter)

name: Murajaah
explanation: Revision of the memorised verses everyday

name: Tadabur
explanation: Reflect on the verses of the Qur'an or Hadith of the Prophet

name: Health Habits
explanation: Like daily chores such as laying bed, sweeping, washing clothes and the likes

name: Exercise
explanation: Keeping fit ('a strong believer is better than the weak believer') everyday

name: Teeth brushing
explanation: Teeth brushing - using miswak at least twice daily on waking up and before sleeping

name: Healthy Food
explanation: At all items

name: Books
explanation: Picking a book to broaden your knowledge, and must be  done daily

name: Islamic Books
explanation: Picking an islamic book to broaden your knowledge, and must be  done daily

name: Self Development (Books)
explanation: Read books that will increase your self awareness and civilisation

name: Fasting
explanation: Fasting every Mondays and Thursday

name: Friday Sunnah
explanation: Bath ghusl, nail cutting, shaving, reading suratul kahf and going early to the mosque

name: Sadaqah
explanation: Giving charity, even something as simple as a smile to your brother

name: Family Sitting
explanation: Picking a day out of the week to sit wht members o fhte family to treat the book " family sitting-bayatul"

name: Monday (Fasting)
explanation: Fasting every Monday to follow the tradition of the prophet

name: Thursday (Fasting)
explanation: Fasting every Thursday to follow the tradition of the prophet

name: Nail Cutting
explanation: Cutting and cleaning of nails as a sunnah of the prophet on Friday

name: Early Mosque Going
explanation: Going to the mosque very early and calmly

name: Suratul Khaf
explanation: Reciting suratul kahf every Friday especially after Asr

name: Dua Between Asr And Maghrib
explanation: Dua Between Asr And Maghrib

name: Donation
explanation: Giving charity, even something as simple as a smile to your brother

name: Family Discussion
explanation: Discussing important and beneficial islamic topics with the family

name: Thirteenth
explanation: Fasting on the thirteenth of every hijrah month

name: Fourteenth
explanation: Fasting on the fourteenth of every hijrah month

name: Charity
explanation: Giving charity, even something as simple as a smile to your brother

name: Ziyaarah
explanation: Visiting  the graveyard to pray for the dead muslims and as a remembrance of the death and the day of judgement

name: Soliheen
explanation: Picking a time to visit the righteous and pious one amongst brothers or sisters

name: Brotherly Visit
explanation: Picking  a time to visit our brothers to strenghten the bond of brotherhood and assist one another

name: SickVisitation
explanation: Going to hospitals and homes to visit and pray for the sick ones and as an opportunity to give thanks to Allah for His favours upon us

name: Cemetary (Visitation)
explanation: To pray for our our dead ones, a means of remembering death is inevitable
